name.description: The name of the sales tag (e.g., 'Greeting', 'Objection').

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a chat message within the VendaZap AI application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChatMessage entity.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the message was created.

userInput.description: The raw user input in the chat.

generatedMessage.description: The AI-generated sales message based on user input and selected tag.

niche.description: The niche specified by the user for the sales message.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and QAP support. It leverages path-based ownership for private user data and structural segregation to maintain a homogeneous security posture within collections. Denormalization is used to avoid `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations. Specifically:

*   `/users/{userId}/chat_messages/{messageId}`: This path structure enforces strict ownership. Each user has their own collection of chat messages. No other user can access these messages.
*   `/sales_tags/{salesTagId}`: This collection stores global sales tags.  All users can read these tags.

This structure supports secure `list` operations for both chat messages (only the owner can list) and sales tags (all users can list).
